title: Seperate the region
text: If we want to integrate with respect to $$x$$, we would have to break the integral into two pieces, because we have different functions bounding the region over [0,1] and [1,2]. In this case, using the disk method,

title: Disk Method
speech: v is equal to the integral from 0 to 1 of pi x squared d x plus the integral from 1 to 2 of pi times, parentheses 2 minus x,  squared d x

title: Shell Method
text: What would the function be if we used the shell method instead?

subHints.title: Shell Method
subHints.text: In order to use Shell Method in this case, we need to use function of $$y$$ to represent the curves. Since we have $$x=y$$ and $$y=2-x$$ then $$x=2-y$$, we will replace $$x$$ in the given functions to get a new function in term of $$y$$.

speech: What would the function be if we used the shell method instead?
pacedSpeech: What would the function be if we used the shell method instead?

title: Shell Method
text: What would the limits of the function revolving around the y-axis? Express in Interval Expression
speech: What would the limits of the function revolving around the y-axis? Express in Interval Expression
pacedSpeech: What would the limits of the function revolving around the y-axis? Express in Interval Expression

title: Shell Method
text: The integral of the Shell Method can be set up as $$V=\int_{0}^{1} 2\pi y \left(2-y-y\right) \,dy=\int_{0}^{1} 2\pi y \left(2-2y\right) \,dy$$
speech: The integral of the Shell Method can be set up as    v is equal to the integral from 0 to 1 of 2 pi y, parentheses, 2 minus y minus y,  times d y is equal to the integral from 0 to 1 of 2 pi y, parentheses, 2 minus 2 y,  times d y
pacedSpeech: The integral of the Shell Method can be set up as  this expression
